quoteText: A friend is one who has the same enemies as you have.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Never regret what you don't write.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: What kills a skunk is the publicity it gives itself.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Four score and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent, a new nation, conceived in Liberty, and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: The leading rule for the lawyer, as for the man of every calling, is diligence.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away, it's best to let him run.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Let not him who is houseless pull down the house of another, but let him work diligently and build one for himself, thus by example assuring that his own shall be safe from violence when built.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: There is no grievance that is a fit object of redress by mob law.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: With the fearful strain that is on me night and day, if I did not laugh I should die.
author: Abraham Lincoln
